Unrecognized: Other/unknown land cover not belonging to the defined classes; unclear or mixed regions.
Farmland: The segment that is used for farming. It also includes Farmland after crop harvesting and new crop plantation.
Water: Natural water bodies including rivers, ponds, lakes, and marshlands; may contain mixed vegetation or farmland, provided surface water is the dominant feature.
Forest: Segment with single trees, a bunch of trees, small bushes, small forest, big forest.
Built-Up: Man-made structures and infrastructure in urban or rural areas, including buildings, roads, brick factories, and associated paths; minor vegetation may be present if construction dominates.
Meadow: Grassland or any field free of Farmland. Non-concrete rural paths are also annotated as meadow as they have soil textures.
